website_summaries.verdict: The Hoka One One Constant 2 is a reliable stability road running shoe. It can function well for long distance runs and daily training, as well. The construction of the shoe provides enough cushioning and adequate support. Given all the negative and positive comments, the Constant 2 still needs some improvement but should be able to deliver average performance for casual runners.
pros: The Air Mesh fabric on the upper gives a well-ventilated experience to the runner
The TPU External Heel Counter secures the rear section of the foot, preventing accidental shoe removal
The wide toe box is a great feature for those who have wider feet
The Constant 2 has a padded tongue for additional comfort
The combination of EVA and RMAT technology offers durable support, according to some reviews
The Active Foot Frame lets the foot relax and sink into the mid-sole unit, essentially delivering an underfoot platform that’s specific to the needs of the wearer
cons: There were runners who noted that the outsole rubber wore off easily after a few months

customer_reviews.title: Best Tennis Shoe I have every owned!
customer_reviews.text: These are the very best tennis shoes I have every owned!!! I have severe arthritis in both ankles and knees from an accident, so I am constantly looking for "miracle" shoes. Well, I think I have found them!!! It will take some doing to get me to ever consider any other tennis shoe!! Wish I could wear them everyday to work!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied old man
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes for someone that wants a lot of support and tones of cushion. I am a 54 year old runner with a some moderate knee pain. The Constants have been the best shoes I've run in for my current needs. They are comparable to the Brooks Transcends or Nike Odysseys. I think it probably varies for the individual but I need to drop a 1/2 size from what I normally but in running shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for everybody
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are not for everybody and certainly not for a 63 year old pronator. I ran 3 miles and thought my knees were going to catch fire! I dont know if they over compensate or what! I bought these based on other reviews and they just dont work for me. I also dont like that the tongue of the shoe is sewn in on one side. I like to adjust the tongue. Not possible with this shoe. The Clifton is a neutral Hoka and worked much better for me.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Weldon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cushioning as expected
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cushioning as expected. However, wider than my previous Hoka One One's. Also, the tongue of the shoe is only one sided making it harder to get in and out of and doesn't tight up as well when lacing.
customer_reviews.author: JMC

customer_reviews.title: Bit long - nice shoe
customer_reviews.text: Width was good but too long. I wear an 11 EE. Really a 10.5 in length. Size finder suggested an 11.5 to get the width. Width was good but very long. These are stabilizer - help with inside/pronation. I really just need neutral. Hokas have high cushion/soft, these have some rebound. The rocker motion is quite nice too.
customer_reviews.author: SolateNite

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I've owned for what I do - run on concrete. Needed a mix of cushion and support. I also highly recommend another Hoka shoe, the Valor, for lots of walking and standing on hard surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: The orthopedic surgeons both recommended these shoes since they run in them and have ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after our son had multiple fractures in his feet from overtraining. He is a distance runner who doesn't quit. The orthopedic surgeons both recommended these shoes since they run in them and have good luck with enough support to sustain major training. So far so good :)
customer_reviews.author: Halla

customer_reviews.title: Best running shoes I have ever purchased
customer_reviews.text: Best running shoes I have ever purchased. The shoe provides a lot of cushion and support. I have had heel spurs, plantar fasciitis - these shoes help me baby my feet. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: RMBC76

customer_reviews.title: Husband describes as "walking on air"
customer_reviews.text: Second pair purchased for my husband. He described them as feeling like you are walking on air. He walks a lot for work, so he put his first pair through the test.
customer_reviews.author: Angel-Q

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My third pair. Hard to find; so I am guessing Hoka has discontinued them? Would be good to know what the best replacement model is for future purchases. They are a soft ride. Might be why they wear out so quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie M. Nichols

customer_reviews.title: Horrible quality
customer_reviews.text: Came too small and with a miss cut insole, ran with them twice and could not complete both runs from the pain. beware...
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Feels great on long walks.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent you; kind of weird with the tongues sewn to one side of the shoe. But really no big issue. Feels more stable than the Bondi.
customer_reviews.author: J'aime lire

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hokas!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pair of running shoes....the best Hoka has produced for my needs. Too bad they have been discontinued.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy Ibarra

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great shoes, very good for people with plantars or heel problems...
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Clark

customer_reviews.title: Good ride
customer_reviews.text: Very cushioned ride but light. I have had a few injuries lately and wanted to try a more cushioned shoe, this one fits the bill perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: The insoles are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected, very light. The sole is stiff which helps prevent extra stress on injured toes (main reason for getting these). The insoles are very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still working with the shoe. Heel cup is not gripping too well... :/
customer_reviews.author: S. M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, fit nicely, looking forward to putting them on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Danny W.

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my husband because I have 3 pairs and wanted him to know why I spent so much money for my Hoka's. He said that they are the most comfortable shoes that he has ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are comfortable shoes that are great for walking
customer_reviews.text: These are comfortable shoes that are great for walking. They needed a little breaking in to get used to the high arch.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan R. Sheiner

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like these for long runs. The extra cushioning feel good
customer_reviews.author: Happy customer

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Hard to say because o got a blister first time I used them
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Gijanto

customer_reviews.title: hoka one one constant 2
customer_reviews.text: I use 10.5 size on all my running shoes these feel a bit loose, but acceptable. First pair I buy.
customer_reviews.author: Benito Perez

customer_reviews.title: As good as expected
customer_reviews.text: So far they're pretty good. A little stiff but they'll break in. Lots of support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: This is my first pair of Hokas, so the jury is still somewhat out. Good cushioning but a bit wobbly compared to, say, Asics.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable, good for my shin splints, but poor grip on road and sole might wear out quickly
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, well-cushioned shoe. Doesn't give me shin splints when many other shoes do. Downside: the grip kind of sucks on the road and after two runs I already noticed some wear. I know this is sort of a trail shoe, which are expected to wear out faster on road running than road shoes (for some reason, I never understood why). I get the feeling it won't last very long.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Galperin

customer_reviews.title: great shoes, can certainly feel the difference between new ...
customer_reviews.text: great shoes, can certainly feel the difference between new Hokas and those i've had for several months. These fit fine, but the toe is a little tighter than other Hokas. Arch support is better than other Hokas, but I'd like even more arch support.
customer_reviews.author: Wes Highfill

customer_reviews.title: These are great.
customer_reviews.text: Hoka is my new 'Go To' exercise shoe. These are great.
customer_reviews.author: R$C

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes on the market and a great price from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Cobb

customer_reviews.title: A Must For Troubled Feet!
customer_reviews.text: I have trouble with my feet. These shoes make it possible for me to go the whole day in comfort without pain.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Van Fossen

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great confort, this is my first experience with Hoka. I hope I get the perfect fit next time
customer_reviews.author: Javier Rodas Godoy

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Most comfortable running shoe I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Great fit. Most comfortable running shoe I've ever had. Just coming back from tibial stress fractures and have had no issues so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: HOKA Constant 2 Men's Running Shoe, Grey/Blue, UK11.5
product_meta.description: The Hoka Constant 2 Running Shoes Another bold innovation from the Hoka design team that continues to reframe the way runners approach traditional notions of control and stability. The Constant is Hoka's widest fitting model yet, with a real focus on stable, comfortable ground contact when it's needed most. A smart combination of soft foams and highly springy foams shaped asymmetrically through the midsole to mirror the biomechanics of the foot and especially its moments of greatest need has resulted in one of the most incredibly comfortable and intuitive Hoka OneOne road models yet conceived. A breathable mesh upper allows for increased air flow in the shoe encouraging an environment that is cooler and more comfortable for the wearer. The seamless construction of the synthetic overlays deliver a more stable fit and shoe build while still allowing for freedom of movement and foot flex. The design of the Constant delivers a shoe that ensures a superior level of responsiveness despite the high level of cushioning gained through intelligent design. The midsole allows for the correct level of deformation to provide you with lightweight responsiveness and an enhanced feeling of stability. The mixed capabilities of the Hoka Constant Women's Running Shoes are designed to handle both the road and light trail, for when you feel the urge to go off the beaten path. The Hoka Constant Running Shoes utilises unique Oversize Technology to deliver the ultimate in performance, cushioning and comfort. OVERSIZE TECHNOLOGY Rolling Motion Meta-Rocker midsole geometry, specifically engineered with a low heel-toe differential and a sculpted outsole radius in the heel and toe, encourages a guided foot gait cycle. This supports a runner's natural form and encourages an efficient, continuous, positive rolling motion from heel strike to toe-off. Protection Engineered midsole volume is up to 2.5 times the volume of performance-specific material compared to standard running shoes. This provides
feature_bullets: Breathable Mesh Upper - Delivers an adaptive, comfortable fit. with maximum breathability.
Padded Tongue - Helps provide a frictionless, customized fit and extra protection from debris.
Asymmetric Lacing for Reduced Tongue Pressure
TPU External Heel Counter - Provides Support.
Late Stage Meta-Rocker Geometry - Provides improved stability.
